page.title: 06THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: Conveniently located on Main Street, near the old centre of the village, the shop and bakery have a staff of ten. Two of the staff work in the bakery, where bread is baked in an oven used since 1891.A large loaf costs 50p. A range of bread and cakes are made.Cold meats and prepared salads are the products most frequently bought. The customers who are mainly but not entirely local residents often come for butter, cheese, tinned food,biscuits and wine and spirits. The shop closes Wednesday afternoons and Sundays. Saturday morning is the busiest time.Links with the past are retained despite the introduction of self-service and off-licence facilities.
